quotes.text: The best way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
quotes.author: Walt Disney

quotes.text: Don't let yesterday take up too much of today.
quotes.author: Will Rogers

quotes.text: It's not whether you get knocked down, it's whether you get up.
quotes.author: Vince Lombardi

quotes.text: If you are working on something exciting, it will keep you motivated.
quotes.author: Steve Jobs

quotes.text: Success is not in what you have, but who you are.
quotes.author: Bo Bennett

quotes.text: Code is like humor. When you have to explain it, it’s bad.
quotes.author: Cory House

quotes.text: Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute.
quotes.author: Harold Abelson

quotes.text: First, solve the problem. Then, write the code.
quotes.author: John Johnson

quotes.text: Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.
quotes.author: Martin Fowler

quotes.text: Experience is the name everyone gives to their mistakes.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: In order to be irreplaceable, one must always be different.
quotes.author: Coco Chanel

quotes.text: Java is to JavaScript what car is to Carpet.
quotes.author: Chris Heilmann

quotes.text: Knowledge is power.
quotes.author: Francis Bacon

quotes.text: Fix the cause, not the symptom.
quotes.author: Steve Maguire

quotes.text: Optimism is an occupational hazard of programming: feedback is the treatment.
quotes.author: Kent Beck

quotes.text: Simplicity is the soul of efficiency.
quotes.author: Austin Freeman

quotes.text: Before software can be reusable it first has to be usable.
quotes.author: Ralph Johnson

quotes.text: Make it work, make it right, make it fast.
quotes.author: Kent Beck

quotes.text: Quality is not an act, it is a habit.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
quotes.author: Steve Jobs

quotes.text: Perfection is achieved not when there is nothing more to add, but rather when there is nothing more to take away.
quotes.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quotes.text: Sometimes it pays to stay in bed on Monday, rather than spending the rest of the week debugging Monday’s code.
quotes.author: Dan Salomon

quotes.text: Testing leads to failure, and failure leads to understanding.
quotes.author: Burt Rutan

quotes.text: If you can’t explain it simply, you don’t understand it well enough.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.text: Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication.
quotes.author: Leonardo da Vinci

quotes.text: Talk is cheap. Show me the code.
quotes.author: Linus Torvalds

quotes.text: Walking on water and developing software from a specification are easy if both are frozen.
quotes.author: Edward V Berard

quotes.text: When to use iterative development? You should use iterative development only on projects that you want to succeed.
quotes.author: Martin Fowler

quotes.text: Controlling complexity is the essence of computer programming.
quotes.author: Brian Kernighan

quotes.text: Any product that needs a manual is broken.
quotes.author: Elon Musk

quotes.text: The function of good software is to make the complex appear to be simple.
quotes.author: Grady Booch

quotes.text: As soon as we started programming, we found to our surprise that it wasn’t as easy to get programs right as we had thought.
quotes.author: Maurice Wilkes

quotes.text: The most disastrous thing that you can ever learn is your first programming language.
quotes.author: Alan Kay

quotes.text: Computers are good at following instructions, but not at reading your mind.
quotes.author: Donald Knuth

quotes.text: There are two ways to write error-free programs; only the third one works.
quotes.author: Alan Perlis

quotes.text: Programming is like writing a book... except if you miss out a single comma on page 126 the whole thing makes no sense.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
quotes.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes.text: Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.
quotes.author: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.text: Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.
quotes.author: Arthur Ashe

quotes.text: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
quotes.author: William James

quotes.text: Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.text: Don’t be afraid to give up the good to go for the great.
quotes.author: John D. Rockefeller

quotes.text: I find that the harder I work, the more luck I seem to have.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.text: Success is not in what you have, but who you are.
quotes.author: Bo Bennett

quotes.text: Success is walking from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.text: If you really look closely, most overnight successes took a long time.
quotes.author: Steve Jobs

quotes.text: Whether you think you can or think you can’t, you’re right.
quotes.author: Henry Ford

quotes.text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.text: Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.
quotes.author: Arthur Ashe

quotes.text: You don’t have to be great to start, but you have to start to be great.
quotes.author: Zig Ziglar
